meanings.definition: To fill with blood and cause to swell
meanings.sent1: The mosquito was engorging on my arm, making it swell up.
meanings.sent2: After the injury, the bruise started engorging with blood, causing pain.
meanings.sent3: The balloon engorged with air until it popped, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her cheeks engorged with embarrassment, turning a deep shade of red.
meanings.sent5: The river engorged with rainwater, flooding the nearby fields.

meanings.sent1: The hungry child was engorging his favorite candy, not sharing with anyone.
meanings.sent2: The competitive eater was engorging hot dogs at an incredible speed.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel engorged on nuts, storing them away for the winter.
meanings.sent4: The bookworm engorged on novels, finishing one after another in a day.
meanings.sent5: The greedy villain engorged his wealth, never satisfied with what he had.
